intro: Machaeranthera tenuis, commonly known as the narrowleaf tansy, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has slender, branching stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs. Machaeranthera tenuis is typically found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
